events.name: Kindergarten Counseling
events.description:
Objective: The 0-6 age period is a time of rapid growth, development, and learning, where fundamental habits are acquired, life is experienced through play, and basic impressions about ourselves and our surroundings are formed. This training will enable professionals working in the field to observe behavioral and psychological problems in children at an early stage, providing support to both children and their families.

Who It Is For: The training is open only to Psychologists, Psychological Counselors, Child Development Specialists, consultants working in preschool institutions, and students of related fields.

Platform for the Training: Google Meet

Document to Be Awarded at the End of Training: Digital Certificate Approved by the Mental Health Association

Training Fee: 950 TL

events.name: Psychopathology I: Anxiety Disorders
events.description:
In this training program, the aim is to address anxiety disorders both theoretically and scientifically, as well as to explain the therapy methods applied by different schools specifically for this disorder.

First Session: In the first session, participants will learn about the etiology (origins), epidemiology (prevalence), symptoms, and distinct features of anxiety disorders as proposed by different schools, presented along with case examples.

Second Session: The second session will focus on learning the therapeutic approaches, specific techniques, and fundamental principles of different schools regarding the treatment of anxiety disorders, supported with various case examples and videos.

Throughout the training process, case examples from different fields and practices will be presented, and interactive studies and discussions will take place.

The sessions will occur via Zoom on Wednesday evenings, March 27 and April 3, from 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM.

Capacity: 10-15 People.

Training Fee: 1,500 TL
Early Registration: Those who register by March 20th will be charged 1,000 TL. 
Late Registration: From March 20th to April 3rd, the fee will be 1,500 TL. 
Your registration will be confirmed once you send the payment receipt to pskderinkubilay@gmail.com.

events.name: WISC-R Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children
events.description:
Training Objective:
To gain competency in administering, evaluating, and reporting the WISC-R intelligence test as part of the intelligence tests package.

Training Introduction:
The Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children is one of the most frequently used tools in research and intelligence measurements. It includes examples from various ability areas in its subtests, its principles of interpretation and scoring are clear, and it has satisfactory psychometric properties. It was revised by D. Wechsler in 1974.

Training Program:
Participants are required to read the WISC-R manual before the training (materials for pre-reading will be sent by our institution to those who cannot obtain it).
Explanation of the subtests verbally, introduction of forms and test materials, explanation of scoring
Participants start practicing the administration of the test,
Practicing test scoring, observing a real application, explaining report writing, continuing with practical applications,
Application-Evaluation,
Supervision and Monitoring.

Document to be Awarded at the End of Training:
Practitioner Certificate (Approved by the Mental Health Association)

Training Fee
3000 TL

Materials Fee
1400 TL (With case)
1300 TL (Without case)

events.name: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Certificate Program
events.description:
The certificate program's content has been developed in parallel with the Beck Institute's training program, illuminated by Assoc. Prof. Dr. Itƒ±r Tarƒ± C√∂mert's 20 years of CBT experience. It offers participants not only the theoretical transmission of CBT's fundamental concepts and techniques but also practical applications, including how these techniques are used by therapists, how formulation is done, supplemented with example session videos, role-plays, supervision-supported review sessions, and case analyses.

Program Operation
In each module of the program, alongside the theoretical presentation, participants are shown example session videos by Assoc. Prof. Dr. Itƒ±r Tarƒ± C√∂mert, followed by experiencing the therapy process through role-plays. Instead of a passive learning process, participants engage in an active learning experience by taking on the roles of both therapist and client. At the end of each module, a detailed discussion is conducted on how to approach a case specific to that module, how questions are asked, and a general summary of the module is provided. Additionally, supervision-supported review sessions are held outside of the training days at the end of each module. These sessions aim for the internalization of the module by the participants through reviews, role-plays, and case analyses.

events.name: MMPI Certification Program
events.description:
Program Operation

Subject Contents

1. Theoretical and Conceptual Content of the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory (MMPI):
‚ñ´Ô∏èThe development purpose and process of the MMPI; transmission of its psychometric properties
‚ñ´Ô∏èEmphasizing the advantages and limitations of the MMPI
Transmission of the Turkish standardization study
‚ñ´Ô∏èExplanation of why MMPI 2 was needed

2. Application of the MMPI
‚ñ´Ô∏èImportant considerations for administering the test (who it should be administered to, under what physical conditions, who it should not be administered to)
‚ñ´Ô∏èConsiderations during the test interview and the testing process
‚ñ´Ô∏èHow observations should be interpreted

3. Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory (MMPI):
‚ñ´Ô∏èIntroduction of validity and clinical subscales
‚ñ´Ô∏èIdentification of Dual Elevations
‚ñ´Ô∏èDetermination and interpretation of configurations
‚ñ´Ô∏èExamination of psychotic and neurotic profiles
‚ñ´Ô∏èExamples of invalid profiles

4. Interpretation of the MMPI
‚ñ´Ô∏èHow to derive and what to pay attention to in the MMPI profile
‚ñ´Ô∏èCalculations on a computer, how to use the computer program
‚ñ´Ô∏èPractical profile creation using an example answer key
‚ñ´Ô∏èHandling validity subscales individually and as a whole through example profiles
‚ñ´Ô∏èInterpreting rising and falling scales in clinical subscales
‚ñ´Ô∏èDetermining the client's level of adjustment
Interpretation of dual and triple elevations
‚ñ´Ô∏èAddressing specific patterns in validity and clinical subscales
‚ñ´Ô∏èInterpreting the profile in its entirety by considering validity and clinical subscale findings together

5. Reporting the Profile
‚ñ´Ô∏èPoints to consider in reporting
‚ñ´Ô∏èIntegrating clinical observation with the MMPI profile
‚ñ´Ô∏èTranslating identified findings in the profile into a written report
‚ñ´Ô∏èWorking on example reports and providing sample reports

events.name: Therapist's Toolbox
events.description:
In our psychotherapy practice, regardless of which map we use, there are fundamental techniques that guide us in therapy. These are the techniques that enrich a therapist's toolkit, develop the therapist, and provide flexibility.

Responding to the demands from our students and graduates, we recognized the need for such a training package. Thus, we, POEM and Psychotherapy Turkey, have designed a series of trainings called 'The Therapist's Toolkit.'

This program aims to provide participants with theoretical knowledge about various techniques that can be used in psychotherapy practice, equip them with skills on how these techniques can be practically applied, and support them in gaining experience about the therapy room through example applications.

events.name: Couple Problem Solving Techniques
events.description:
Training Objective:
The aim is to manage problems in relationships constructively, ensure mutual understanding between partners, and cause positive effects such as happiness, openness, strength, harmony, and satisfaction in relationships, as well as change and development. To gain problem-solving skills.

Training Content:
Problems experienced in relationships, unresolved issues
Lack of communication
Feeling valued in relationships
Secrets of being a happy couple
Crisis management in relationships
Toxic relationships and ways to escape them
Effective Communication in Marriage
Communication Breakdown Between Spouses
How to Solve Communication Problems in Relationships
Problem Solving with Partner and Marital Harmony
What Couples in Disagreement Should Do
How problems should be solved
Acknowledging the existence of a problem, correctly identifying the problem
Generating alternatives for solutions
How it should be applied
Evaluating the outcome
Training Duration: 3 Sessions, 6 Hours
Training Fee: 750 TL

Certificate to be Awarded at the End of the Training:
Participation Certificate Approved by the Mental Health Association

events.name: Moxo Attention Test Training
events.description:
Training Objective
This training aims to provide information about working methods with individuals who have Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) and to equip professionals with knowledge and skills about administering the MOXO test.

What is MOXO?
The MOXO Attention Test is an online test, administered by professionals, that measures Attention, Timing, Impulsivity, and Hyperactivity performance without involving opinions or feelings.

MOXO has been found to be highly effective in measuring levels of Attention, Timing, Impulsivity, and Hyperactivity performance; however, the test's rapidly increasing popularity is attributed to the unique Distraction System found in MOXO.

To focus on a seemingly simple MOXO task, an individual must ignore visual and auditory distractions in the test, just as they would need to in daily life. This requires active inhibition of distractions, making the test more challenging and advancing its decisive qualities.

MOXO Child Test
The MOXO Child Test is specifically designed for children aged 6-12 and serves as an auxiliary tool for ADHD diagnosis and patient observation processes for professionals. It is a short and online test containing various stimuli and distractors.

A 15-minute online test with age-appropriate stimuli
Various languages audio instructions and a trial session easily understandable by children
A unique set of distractors that allows testing of an individual's performance under different environmental conditions
An up-to-date norm base covering ages 6 and up
A performance graph that measures the change in an individual's performance over time (during the test)
An online interface easily accessible from any computer with internet access using only a keyboard, without any additional devices
Patient information secured with high-level security according to USA-HIPPA privacy laws and regulations

MOXO Adolescent & Adult Test
The MOXO Adolescent&Adult test covers the age range of 13-65 and assists professionals in evaluating the attention profile of patients in ADHD diagnosis and observation processes. The MOXO Adolescent&Adult ADHD Test models the environmental conditions an individual faces in daily life with its unique distraction system.

An 18-minute online test with appropriate stimuli and distractors
A unique set of distractors that allows testing of an individual's performance under different environmental conditions
A regularly updated norm base consisting of a total of 900 individuals from different countries
A performance graph that measures the change in an individual's performance over time (during the test)
An online interface easily accessible from any computer with internet access using only a keyboard, without any additional devices
Patient information secured with high-level security according to USA-HIPPA privacy laws and regulations

Who Can Attend the Training?
The training is intended for Psychologists, Psychiatrists, Psychological Counselors, Special Education Specialists, and senior students of related fields.

Document to be Awarded at the End of Training
A MOXO Practitioner Expert Certificate will be awarded.

Quota
Limited.

Platform Where the Training Will Take Place
Google Meet

Training Fee
2000 TL.

events.name: 35 Basic Techniques Used in Psychotherapy
events.description:
Within the scope of the program, regardless of the school they practice, participants will be provided with 35 fundamental techniques from various approaches, essential for their toolkit. These techniques are designed to facilitate swift change in clients, especially when encountering challenges during psychotherapy sessions.

The objective of the program is to impart practical skills in applying a wide array of fundamental techniques functional in therapy and derived from many different schools. Throughout the program, participants will be introduced to the theoretical underpinnings of effective and functional techniques from evidence-based therapeutic schools.

Following this theoretical presentation, participants will be given detailed instructions on how to apply these techniques through case studies, and will have the opportunity to practice these techniques through role-plays. This approach ensures that participants complete the program with both a theoretical understanding and practical experience in applying these key techniques.
